the following address be present on february at a popcorn forum
it would seem that in today s world there be two basic way of look at the university
the first consider the university to be a problemsolving institution
the university will clean up lake michigan provide social justice discover the cause of crime provide remedy and take care of many inequity in the university be akin to the department of health agriculture welfare and also the police department
the education of the student be secondary in such a picture whereas the need of the community come first
under this view of the university the regent can issue the professor a mandate tell them what their philosophy of education be to be and the administration follow the regent lead can resort to parliamentary legerdemain to make sure the mandate be obey
this be what we have experience at the university of wisconsinmilwaukee a mandate follow by parliamentary evasion
the second basic way of look at a university be quite distinct from the first
it consider the university to be a academy a house of reason that have be set aside from the political and commercial world so that professor and their student can study dispassionately without the fetter of predetermined mandate and mission
there will be some passion of course like that of the poet who have intuitively light on a new metaphor reward with another dead sea scroll but there will not be the willful ruthless passion of quotidian politics
according to this view the education of the student be primary not secondary
all the student be endow with human dignity which mean they can not be use as mean to a end
the university exist for the student they do not exist for the university nor do they exist for the state
in the light of what i have just say let us consider the mandate for socalled cultural diversity
a university have unique tradition just as a hospital do or a court of law or a athletic team
in a hospital for example a certain room be set aside for specific purpose
we call this a operating room
only a few people be allow to enter here a couple of doctor several nurse and perhaps a orderly all of whom must perform prescribed ritual before enter they must scrub themselves with soap cover rule apply only in a hospital
they could not be exercise elsewhere for example as in a court of justice where many people must be allow to enter
on the other hand the law court have a judge who be really a monarch a person of tremendous authority who could not be tolerate elsewhere in a democratic society and certainly not in a classroom
finally a good example of what i say about special rule come from the sport of football where line of demarcation be draw around the field
within those line one can run into a man and hammer him into the ground possibly dislocate his shoulder
and the audience will applaud if you do the same thing one yard outside the line you will be give a fifteenyard penalty and if you do it just a mile away on wisconsin avenue a policeman will come to arrest you
the same rule do not obtain everywhere
and so it be within a university
a father and mother a free university where professor have to ascertain the truth and educate their student you simply do not issue mandate
it be not allow
in a company of infantry the captain will issue a mandate order his troop to seize the high ground because there be no time for committee meeting and democratic decisionmaking in the heat of battle someone have to give a immediate order
but a university be not like that for authority here be the weakest of all argument
a proposition be not true because plato or aristotle say it rather they say it because they have a insight into the truth
and geometry be not true because euclid say it rather he be a exceptionally talented man who discover many truth about measurement
the point be that mandate be out of place and destructive in a university
the argument have be make to favor the socalled cultural diversity requirement that university be biased even prejudiced because the curriculum insist on european author and institution predominantly caucasian
let us examine this accusation in the light of traditional study
in ancient time there be many great nation the egyptian persian phoenician mede hittite etruscan carthaginian and others and then there be the greek a small nation consist perhaps of a million people or even less
nevertheless in the university today one could base onethird or half of the curriculum on the greek alone or even more not because they be caucasian or our ancestor or our favorite or our crowd as they say in politics but simply because their creation surpass those of other nation
the philosophical debate we be conduct in this room today would be impossible without the greek who found the science of epistemology and the art of rhetoric
our very citizenship for example when we say i be a american citizen would not exist be it not for the greek polis which the roman subsequently adopt as the civitas or citystate
greek invention and the same statement will hold for narrative and lyrical poetry the homeric epopee and pindaric ode
and just take a look at our science philosophy psychology history mathematics zoology biology they be all greek discovery
why their very name be greek
there be no feeling here of a antihittite prejudice
and nobody be about to call the ancient etruscan and mede disparaging racial name or to create for the phoenician a humiliating pale of settlement
all these nation be equally welcome to the academic community and indeed a few professor will devote their entire life to study the language archaeology and history of their people
but in assign broad general education requirement one must throw one s support to the greek
it be a question of professional choice not caprice or political preferment
nor in this choice be there any trace of racism
we come now to the heart of the matter the student and their general education requirement that take regardless of their major field of study
traditionally student have have to take course in a few discipline for example in the college of letter and science they have be oblige to enroll in two discipline in the natural science social science and humanities which would mean history philosophy economics anthropology physics and so forth
but senate document which be under question here today specify a requirement in the life experience of four race hispanic afroamerican american indian and asian
what do lift experience mean do it mean a series of anecdote a advertisement of the self a rhetoric of assertion indoctrination a reduction of subject like philosophy and history to popular culture with a popular methodology or what the document do not say and the faculty have not be give the opportunity to discuss the question
one hundred and fifteen professor sign a petition request a meeting for such a discussion but the supporter of the meeting hall carry picket say socrates be dead gape and gawk into the meeting hall and refuse to come in
consequently there be no discussion no explanation of any kind
and the administration faculty senate and university committee wholeheartedly approve this nonfeasance
i ask myself this question and i ask you also why this refusal to discuss such a revolutionary requirement in education a requirement base on race rather than on the discipline and if one be concerned about transmit the culture of the minority to college student why use a vague term like lift experience why not say the history of hispanic immigrant the sociology of afroamerican the anthropology of the other minority to be teach by the faculty in the department allude to would nt this be the professional way of approach the question
let us turn now from the requirement to the student
the student come to the university of wisconsinmilwaukee may be adult socially but academically they do not display a familiar with louis xiv napoleon bismarck or cavour
in many case they have nt even hear these name nor can they place the thirty year war the french revolution and nineteenthcentury nationalism
in american history they do nt know the figure of our great civil war nor can they distinguish between our president for example between teddy roosevelt and franklin delano roosevelt
most of our student simply do nt know history
in literature they do not perceive the difference between a novel and a play between narrative poetry and lyrical poetry between a essay and a treatise
nor have they hear of the oral tradition the epic poem and ballad
the work of scholar like albert lord and milman parry lie completely outside their experience
the subject they be least familiar with be philosophy where pantheism the allegory of plato s cave noumena and school like cartesianism be word and thought they have never hear before
suffice it to say that the incoming student at that is they do nt know themselves
the general education requirement should be use to fill this void
please understand that i do nt object to the creation of course concerning minority
i be merely argue that they should not be general requirement mandate of everyone and i argue that they should be make professional by substitute history philosophy anthropology and the other discipline for the vague notion of life experience
we be here to educate our student not to transmit ideology
we be here to open a window on their soul not to indoctrinate them
the coercive mandatory nature of senate document which be push through the senate without the faculty s knowledge have create unnecessary grief here
the campus have be polarize over this superficial life experience document whereas a truly professional approach might have be widely accept
why do nt the regent and administration approach the executive committee of three or four department for example history anthropology political science and gentleman would you be willing to create a professorship in your discipline in the study of afroamerican the american indian and other minority we have set aside a ample sum of money to attract a good scholar and there will be some perquisite summer salary support a library budget some travel allowance and stipend for a couple of teach assistant
we want your new professor to create a few good course that will add to the education of our student and gain the respect of the academic community
you will have two year to complete your recruitment
""
i can nt imagine one of the department just name turn down such a offer although under faculty governance it be dearly their right to do so
but if they refuse then the authority without recrimination could approach the executive committee of other department such as cultural geography economics sociology and the foreign language
three or four such professorship with their excellent course would do far more for the coercion and our campus would not be polarize
these course would stand side by side qualitatively with other course in the social science and humanities and they would not require the crutch of mandate for acceptance
i should like now to close my presentation with a reflection on two thought that bode ill for our university
indeed they be ground for deep concern
lately i have be read professor robert o paxton s book on vichy france that is france from to during the second world war
the government there be beset with many problem arise from the tide of refugee who flee to france from all over europe and so it establish a numerus clausus a quota system for cope with these problem
it be not a pleasant picture
i believe that the new ger resolution senate document be really a numerus clausus a quota not only guarantee preference for some citizen but ultimately exclusion for others

why not the precedent have be set and the administration have show its disposition to engage in parliamentary legerdemain
my second thought be grind for even great concern
i would liken the mandate and coercion at the university of wisconsinmilwaukee to the lysenko affair in soviet russia
in this affair a scientist trofim lysenko be director of the institute of genetics in the soviet academy of science
unlike his colleague in other country he reject mendelian genetics in favor of the doctrine of acquired characteristic and owing to his connection with joseph stalin he force his view on soviet agriculture
the effect as you might imagine be disastrous
lysenkoism take the pose of a new freedom in science a blow for progress in the face of outdated traditionalism but the historical reality be different indeed
although the basic question be allege to be a new science it be really a problem it in the lysenko affair not only genetics but all the science impinge on agriculture be tyrannically abuse by quack and timeservers for thirtyfive year
the lysenko affair in short be thirtyfive year of brutal irrationality in the campaign for improved farming
i suggest to you here assemble this afternoon that something similar to the lysenko affair have happen at the university of wisconsinmilwaukee with the irrationality of socalled cultural diversity
cultural diversity be nothing of the sort it be not a generous intellectual effort but a dogma impose on us by the regent and enforce by the administration which clearly do nt want the faculty to debate it or vote on it
in the circumstance it seem a cruel joke to make student enroll in politically motivated racial course when their knowledge of their own culture be want and also their knowledge of themselves

during my year in washington and boston my duty have include give a substantial number of newspaper radio and television interview as well as write column article and book
i often receive advance telephone call from the media that go something like this
caller hello dr delattre you be a ethicist right
ejd no i be a philosopher
caller pause well whatever
or more often but that have something to do with ethics right
ejd yes
caller good
we be do a onehour spot next week on the barney frank affair or academic pricefixing or antiracist regulation in college or ethics in government or corruption in business or the drug control strategy or ethical dilemma in foreign policy and so on
we have someone to say that barney frank should be throw out of congress
we need someone to take the other side
we that we have to grow up and stop be critical of public official
where do you come down or more frequently how do you feel and be you our man
now to anyone who care about ethics or even about intellectual honesty this be pretty grim and frightening stuff
logician will recognize the fallacy of insufficient option the supposition that every real or fabricated issue have exactly two side both extreme
among the media few seem to recognize that some issue have many side while others may have only one that a responsible person can reasonably take
furthermore there be scarcely any sense among producerslet alone the putative ethicist of socrates ideal of dialogue as a shared and cooperative pursuit of the truth or the closest approximation of it by knowledgeable candid people of good will
instead there be a manipulative limitation of ethical discourse to passionate disagreement much of it incivil that be think to be entertaining and therefore marketable the presumption that each side will be resolutely impenetrable to any reasoning that may be offer by the other
thus be reason portray as a mere servant of the passion and seldom if ever as a way of thinking and behave that be ground in the socratic ideal of dialogue
often those who proclaim themselves fit to make ethical pronouncement for the media do not know the fact of a case do not know how to reason conscientiously and do not even have good manner
but they be entirely willing to be impervious to reason
i suppose it be not surprising under such circumstance that i receive inquiry from college student and job applicant i hesitate to say aspirant who say i want to be a ethicist for newspaper and television
where do i go for that kind of job i infer that they want to be celebrity not philosopher and ultimately will measure the success of their career by how often their name appear in column and how frequently other on television
these be the ambulance chaser of ethics
all of this tend to leave the impression that ethics be really indistinguishable from borderline moral fanaticism ordinarily lace with a unhealthy dose of political partisanship or at least the bias of special interest and motive have nothing to do with virtue principle or conscience
it leave the sense that all dispute must be settle by litigation confrontation or raw power and never by reasoned understanding that may lead to honorable compromise or even enlightenment
a central obligation of high education be to stand on high moral ground than this not only for the sake of student but also for the sake of instruct the general public
but all too frequently its spokesman lack the vision decency knowledge competence and ability to reason necessary to do so
not long ago for example the justice department begin a investigation of alleged tuition and financial aid pricefixing by a large group of prestigious college and university side on this issue
while there be relatively little dispute about whether price and financial aid package be actually be fix a surprising number of college spokesman be willing remorselessly to defend the practice
this defense of academic pricefixing be deeply disappointing but it be so typical of the shallowness offer up by such advocate that it can scarcely surprise us
the position run along these line certainly we decide together on tuition and financial aid policy amount and package
that be a lot better than have bidding war for student
and besides the cost of education should not be a factor in a student s decision about where to go to school
""
now if ever there be a selfindulgent instance of the fallacy of insufficient option this be it
such spokesman arrogantly tell the public that we have no choice but to suffer either pricefixing or bid war
they offer not the slight suggestion that another option be for each institution in light of its mission and staff compensation its degree of commitment to a economically diverse student body and its financial liability to set annually a responsible price in relation to actual cost per student to determine the portion of financial need it be in a position to meet and to decide the extent to which its mission require scholarship as well as needbased financial aid
nor do they provide even a intimation that have settle these issue as a matter of policy and principle a honorable institution would refuse to engage in bid war
nor be there so much as a hint that use moral restraint when confront with such option be as admirable in institution as in individual
add to this be the arrogant presumptuous and false albeit fashionable claim that family and prospective student should not take cost into account
obviously nobody should choose a college just because it be cheap or just because it be expensive
but as a matter of fact family and student should consider both price and cost though difference in select a college or university and they should be teach by high education institution the wisdom of do so
why consider for example two institution of roughly equal resource
one charge slightly more for tuition and fee but its educational cost per student be proportionately high because of more equitable faculty and staff salary and its noneducational general expense be low because of a longstanding policy of routine physical plant maintenance that avert the high cost of recover from deferred maintenance
or suppose that one be slightly more expensive because despite similar studentfaculty ratio for the two school one maintain small class size and include in its ratio computation only those faculty actually teach class and not those on sabbatical on leave or release for quasiadministrative duty and the like
or one charge high tuition or pay low compensation because it receive financial support from fewer alumnus in small amount than the other
what if the two institution charge exactly the same for tuition but one set that price high level of debt service while the others have build incomparably better equip science laboratory and upgrade equipment as often as be financially possible
suppose that one institution have foolishly and expensively settle extortionate lawsuit when it have do no wrong or incur great legal expense when it have
meanwhile another school have maintain low cost because of sound policy and wise legal counsel fortitude and a sense of loyalty to its own peer review committee
one can imagine other dimension of comparison at will
clearly anyone who know enough about education to take such consideration into account do so when decide which institution be better run and run by the kind of people we should want to teach and guide our daughter and son
to obscure all of this by tell parent that price or cost should not figure in college choice be morally base
equally base be the practice of tell this to our young when in actual fact how much their family spend on them may very much of their grandparent and so on
such blithe and selfrighteous counsel be a invitation to selfishness and injustice and a obstacle to the formation of habit of compassion
it be also a direct affront to any hope of their grasping what make a educational institution worthy of respect and admiration in its priority and policy
high education institution should conduct themselves so that they be in a position to set responsible tuition fee and they should be financially frank with prospective student and their family
this need not be very complicated but it be indispensable to genuinely rational choice
it also have the merit of recall college and university to the obvious fact that most individual and institution behave better when they feel obliged to be candid about what they do and why they do it
such conviction be the greatest spring of accountability possible as have be recognize since long before plato recount the story of the ring of gyges
furthermore nothing less than thinking and act about price and cost in this way can legislator executive branch official and taxpayer
the high moral ground on which high education ought to stand call for more of course than avoid logical fallacy and mindless presumption
unfortunately much of what pass for ethical discourse in college and university now be as confrontational incivil and tenaciously unreasonable as the vignette of media ethicist
who learn what from whom i be not sure but that there be striking similarity between the respective pattern of behavior no one can deny
in both there be sign of moral bankruptcy the belief that persuasion must be coercive and threaten that our fellow human beingswhether trustee faculty administrator or student have neither the conscience nor the intelligence to appreciate moral evidence and that only pass a specific litmus test on issue such as abortion south african investment gay and lesbian awareness cia recruiting curriculum reform and so on qualify anyone as morally decent
some institution allow student and faculty involvement in social
certainly student should become interested in the social and political question face a free people but they deserve to be teach that moral fervor be no substitute for diligent and systematic learning
there be little indication that student demonstration since the s have reflect conscientious study of the relevant issue whether in history philosophy government economics or the science
my criticism should not be confuse with a attack on moral conviction or freedom of speech rather it describe a pattern of institutional failure that allow student or faculty to set aside and even to obstruct educational purpose for which a school college or university have be found
in practice such acquiescence foster the impression that in matter of moral import passion and action be acceptable substitute for knowledge and deliberation
the rational pursuit of truth central to teaching scholarship and research be thereby dim and educational purpose be slight or even dismiss
the absence of conscientious study of the relevant subject matter and issue in moral protest against the war in vietnam and it be equally apparent with respect to the demonstration concerning south africa today
in each instance the moral principle to which protester have appeal be above reproach in the first that america should avoid unjust war in the second that apartheid be wrong
nonetheless because apply principle to specific issue require careful study educational institution have a obligation to promote a responsible process for reach judgment
those who forsake this duty by give in to student demand for the sake of peace and quiet teach the lesson that moral virtue can be separate from intellectual conscientiousness that noise and pressure be acceptable substitute for reasoned discourse and finally that the end justify the mean
student deserve institution that stand on high intellectual and moral ground in the classroom as well as outside it
some institution follow the path of least resistance have allow classroom and administration building to be shut down by student and faculty demonstrator
such closing replace moral discourse with intellectual inquiry and obstruct institutional duty
the administrative decision of yale and john hopkins and other institution to treat shanty as a acceptable expression of opposition to apartheid provide conspicuous example of follow the path of least resistance at the expense of educational purpose
building shanty may attract attention but it do not involve apply intelligence to confront important moral and political issue
as john silber president of boston university argue to treat student who be perfectly capable of harness their mouth to their mind as if they be incapable of articulate speech be a confession of bankruptcy
""
it be also dangerous and selfdefeating to believe that every injustice be intolerable and must be immediately remedy no matter the method
yet many demonstration be base on this misconception
a person who can tolerate no injustice can not live in the world because the world always include condition of injustice but such a person can not consistently opt for social change either because all substantial change be attend by injustice as well
the others and how to reduce injustice without betray other ideal such as liberty privacy and civility
these be often hard question to answer
surely high education ought not indulge symbolic expression when it encourage student to think they have do the right thing without make the effort to answer these hard question
to teach such bad lesson be to forego respect for the civilized intelligence that education both presuppose and hope to nurture
indulge member of a educational institution in such political activity pose a great threat to institutional integrity and the public trust than any possible external pressure
in contrast when i be president of st john s college and concern about south africa begin to spread across america the administration and the finance committee of the board of visitor and governor take the initiative and undertake a inquiry in the tradition of the comprehensiveness of the liberal art
that is they do not ask only should st john s as a protest against apartheid divest itself africa but also pose the question what should be the relation between social political and moral concern and the investment policy of a college devote to the liberal art the committee invite student faculty alumnus staff and board member to submit the best essay editorial and paper they could find on the question and collect them into a book of several hundred page for the use of the college community
it then arrange seminar at the college and with alumnus group throughout the country
ask that no one attend a seminar before read the book which contain diverse and wellreasoned point of view the committee deliberate for eighteen month through these public forum
by engage the community in a dialogue among reasonable people of good will the committee provided the opportunity for fruitful disagreement
it sustained civility limited tension between adversary and reveal the folly of suppose that when two people disagree one of them be invariably bad or morally insensitive
it show where the argument should a college refuse to invest in treasury bill because the united state do business with the soviet union should it ask to examine the portfolio of every donor to insure that none of the income have be generate from south african holding or from holding in other country that violate human right what about income from business whose product and marketing be dangerous or deceitful after these public deliberation the st john s board affirm its duty to advance the financial interest of the college by honorable investment
it decline to divest on the ground that the mere sale of share by one owner to another promise to accomplish nothing in the way of social justice
the board stand by the sullivan principle and resolve to exercise its prerogative as a shareholder in matter of corporate policy
all this be possible because the st john s board and administrator be clear about its educational purpose and be resolve to act in fidelity to them and also because the board clearly recognize and teach that it have both
now i understand that not every institution can undertake such inquiry on this scale
but however their implementation may be tailor to the relevant local circumstance the same principle should be apply
college and university after all be oblige to be embodiment of the ancient truth that the use of force and threat be never as satisfying to a person of excellent character as a resolution by persuasion and reason and that everyone who love justice reflect this in his behavior
some college and university seem to me to be lose sight of the irreplaceable power of the habitual and principled love of justice
they be establish regulation that have no potential to inspire moral aspiration the durable effort to become a human being function at his or her best as legal scholar lon fuller put it and which be not even likely to frighten student into behave well
thus the university of michigan the university of wisconsin the state university of new york at buffalo the university of north carolina at that threaten sanction against student as a mean of control what be now call act of insensitivity
these regulation may only succeed in make student suspicious and distrustful of each other and cause progressively great racial ethnic and gender segregation within university for reason of safety
they may also inspire conspiracy of vengeance and vendetta against individual suspect of have the wrong attitude and they will certainly indeed already do generate first amendment controversy as well as acrimonious wrangling among faculty member
such code will assuredly blur crucial distinction between emotionally hurtful speech and genuine violence
these rule however be very different from the rule against disorderly conduct assault and haze that be quite rightly enforce by the chancellor of the university of mississippi in september 
the incident to which he respond involve several fraternity member and pledge who strip two others scrawl racial slur on their body and dump them at nearby rust college a largely black institution
the chancellor s decision to bar the offending be require to keep faith with anything resemble the standard of a decent university
as a added benefit the debate that arise subsequent to his decision help the campus community to discern the error in one student s comment that the entire fraternity should nt have be punish for what a group of member and pledge do
of course it should have be a institution that can not prevent its member from commit the most egregious violation of serious rule have no right to be spare severe sanction
and the individual involved in such incident ought to be expel because they deserve it and because just punishment show what the university stand for
in contrast insensitivity rule will do little to teach student what their college and university stand for
they will become sign of hypocrisy in institution that sweep problem of drug consumption and alcohol abuse under the rug whose program of study be shallow and lax in expectation of student performance and where absenteeism be ignore cheat be commonplace faculty be be seldom available or facultystudent sexual intimacy be tolerate
and they will not overcome the covert message send out by faculty curriculum review that be incivil and warlike or result in the casting of moral aspersion and accusation of racism
to be respect rule must clearly reflect the broad moral sensibility of their author behavior
where administrator and faculty tolerate all kind of moral deficiency that be within their legitimate institutional authority to address student will treat rule as mere expression of power
they will violate them covertly remorselessly and resentfully and they will look shrewdly for loophole
such rule will not even teach that bigotry and prejudice be beneath us unworthy of us contemptible because they be a violation of all reason and because they be a form of blindness in human being that make us impenetrable to each other and therefore barbaric in our behavior
they will not teach anyone in kant s word to take the place and point of view of the other or the other person s skin and walk around in it
""
they will not teach the lesson of socrates or gandhi or frederick douglass that when one person mistreat another it be the dignity of the wrongdoer that be besmirch not that of the person wrong
they will not teach the lesson of selfreliance that golda meir learn as a child from the pogrom in russia or the freedom from bigotry that she find in milwaukee
the rule will not teach how the maccabean sage eleazar be different from ivan boesky or how to identify evil and resist its allure
they will not teach why the prophet nathan address king david in the third person by the parable of the lamb in order to draw him to see the evil of his treatment of uriah and bathsheba
they will never teach why nathan do that instead of try to make a rule
finally they can not teach in the word of josiah royce that it be profoundly mistake to believe that a neighbor s pain be life dim cold a pale fire beside one s own burning desire
""
of course it will be object that the rule be not supposed to teach all this
to this the reply be then spend your time do what be supposed to teach it
learn the foundation of habit of decency and a principled life take study not rule
at most rule address symbol and never underlying vacuum of ignorance and benightedness
principle be learn when they be learn by exposure to teacher and mentor of fine character by the disciplined study of works worthy of time and devotion by peer pressure for decency by opportunity to reach out to people less fortunate than oneself and by persistent reminder from the intellectual and moral climate of a institution that it expect its member to aspire to become educated man and woman who therefore embody genuinely civilized intelligence
this climate take much more administrative and faculty fortitude and diligence to foster than do the proliferation of implausible the persistent refusal to accept the idea that a educational institution be simply make up of conflicting group of constituent
""
a college or university be explicitly charter to fulfill a educational mission that normally involve teaching learn research and study
it be render taxexempt for the sake of this purpose
all who be member of its community help to fulfill this charge whether they be student teacher trustee cafeteria employee visit donor or security personnel
unless all be join in this common purpose its effort will be episodic and fragmented and this affront to mission be exactly what the constituency mentality cause
it endorse the belief that educational institution be compose of specialinterest group and teach that the purpose of governance and management be to adjudicate the conflicting interest of these group
once this impoverished vision of a educational institution gain sway the hope of building in the word of edward levi a viable and responsible community in which membership signify pressure duty be shatter
no curriculum can take the place of this persistent hope and aspiration but it can obviously play a major role in foster it
this will only be true however if the curriculum be conceive not as a collection of course but as a program of study whose success depend on the faculty member and student who give it life
even more important a curriculum will never become dynamic if it be base on the idea that how people think and what they think be utterly divisible because only if people learn how to reason together can there be limit to the range of possible disagreement
a genuinely reasonable person can no more blithely embrace a contradiction than blindly argue irrelevantly no more ignore the persuasiveness of rational argument than persist in the foolish consistency that emerson call the hobgoblin of little mind
such a individual can no more believe in his own infallibility than assume that his adversary be everywhere and always utterly wrong
thus be method and content irrevocably unite today obscure the fact
this provide another important clue to the design of a worthwhile curriculum student deserve to be expose to mind of the high rank to works of the greatest power because of their power and never merely because of their authorship
on this fundamental criteria inform by a respect for human history construct a program of study that ignore the distinctive contribution of a martin luther king jr a sojourner truth or a golda meir be as much a impossibility as design one that neglect socrates aristotle augustine or einstein
the curriculum need not and should not be limit to great booksit should include great art and music and dance great poetry play and speech great architecture great mathematical proof great scientific experiment example of great eloquence great sacrifice great mistake and great failure great disagreement great evil even if perpetrate by banal people and great heartache
in their study student should spend yes depravity
the latter offer a powerful motive for espouse intellectual and moral humility and expose the dark side of human nature
the former offer a survey of the magnificent range of human possibility and aspiration
learn both of these lesson be the ethical ideal
the intellectual root of high moral aspiration be firmly anchor in the high ground of greatness
dwelling on that ground be what give a college or university the right to be call a place of high education
otherwise it should only be call a place of later education
by edwin xxj delattre
edwin xxj delattre be olin resident scholar in applied ethics and professor of education at boston university boston ma 
he be also adjunct scholar of the american enterprise institute in washington dc
this paper be base on a keynote address present to the mississippi association of college on october 
for anyone who take a university degree more than three or four year ago read a college catalogue or be tell what academic be up to these day be likely to be a disorienting experience
a confusing array of apparently new discipline have spring up each call itself by a name that give little if any indication of what it might be about
a partial list of these name include poststructuralism reader response criticism gender study lacanian psychoanalysis critical theory theory canonicity semiotics cultural materialism reception aesthetic the new history the new historicism film theory critical legal study and comparable approach in anthropology the science and elsewhere
this be certainly a formidable array of term
but it turn out that the scholarly activity the term designate be remarkably similar to one another
however much the practitioner of these methodology pretend to be pursue new kind of study and however arcane their vocabulary they actually share a single elementary foster intellectual disequilibrium
the method be a assault on normative description of reality that is to say on our everyday common sense understanding of what the world be like
but why it may well be ask would anyone want to be involved in such a undertaking the answer lie in politics
for today s newstyled academic scholarship serve as a substitute for radical political action
the political ideal for today s academic would be to participate in a act of revolutionary overthrow or at least one bring about a radical restructuring of society as it be often phrase
naturally he be unable to realize this ideal directly
but in recent year mean have be create whereby he can enact something like this wish through scholarship
his course of action be base on what may be the single genuine insight of the new methodology
this be that society rest ultimately on a shared conception of reality among its member
without a silent consensus on such a matter it be evident resolve matter of law and equity or enter into contract
each field of scholarship rest on a similar conceptual contract
the practitioner of the methodology therefore reason again with justice that to shake the certainty on which their own particular field of scholarship rest be likely to destabilize that field
such a destabilization have in fact be accomplish in the humanistic and social science discipline and to some extent in the science cause considerable dismay among traditional scholar
in fact so thoroughly have such scholar be catch up in defend the traditional methodology that most of them have fail to recognize the challenge they be face for what it really be namely a political gesture
this gesture amount to be a academic imitation of a politically revolutionary act
radical academic believe that the university be structure in the same way as they believe society to be structure that is with a ruling class on the one side and a exploited class on the other
they conceive of the university as rule tenure professor
the exploited class consist of the young untenured professor and the student
by challenge the kind of scholarship practice by the old professor the practitioner of one of the new methodology fancy himself as strike a blow on behalf of the downtrodden
it would be a exaggeration to say that every academic who practice one of the new methodology think of himself as a revolutionary actor
some academic as i have already mention want to restructure rather than overthrow society
other especially graduate student and begin instructor may not be aware of the political attitude underlie the methodology they have choose to practice
just as a political movement include both strategist and distributor of flier so be it with the new methodology each have its theorist on the one extreme and its devoted reader and follower on the other
similarly just as in a political context there be those who grasp the ideological purpose of the opposition and those whose concern remain limited to the local and the practical of the new methodology
some understand the politics and some do not
still others understand but prefer to deny the politics
that however be a matter beyond the scope of the present essay
""
once one understand the politics of the new methodology it be relatively easy to see how each of them works
i propose briefly to examine four methodology deconstruction feminist criticism the new historicism and film theory
at first sight the four would appear to be as widely separate and seemingly unrelated to one another as could be imagine
each have its own barely penetrable terminology and claim to employ a unique analytic method
but the term encounter in go from one to another of the four turn out to be many way of represent the same few thing
in fact all four methodology come down to be version of a single surprisingly elementary concept that of class struggle
each of the four methodology represent class struggle on the same model of exploitation both a exploit and a exploited class
just as with the class analysis of the university furthermore the sin of the exploiter have to do not with economic or political dominance as they would in the marxist model that be obviously be imitate but rather with intellectual style
each of the new methodology designate the intellectual style it abhor by a different new jargonish term
but as the account that follow try to make dear the methodology do not really make discovery about reality
their purpose be to create a political drama in which their practitioner first invent a exploit and a exploited class and then in a kind of symbolic imitation of political revolutionism proceed to denigrate the one and identify with the other
deconstruction
among contemporary methodology deconstruction a mode of reading and discuss literature be consistently identify by practitioner of the other methodology as their source and inspiration
the central focus of deconstruction as represent in the writing of jacques derrida be a attack on something it they mean by logocentrism for the signature gesture of their movement be never to define or be entirely clear about anything
nevertheless it gradually do grow clear that logocentrism designate a supposedly mistaken belief in the stability of language and phenomenon
according to deconstructionist analysis the logocentrist deceive himself that the world be graspable by intellect and communicable by language
he naively believe as jonathan culler put it in his admiring account of deconstruction in thought truth reason
for this he be at once both ridicule and deplore
for all its apparent philosophical sophistication the deconstructionist attack on logocentrism rest on a garbled extension of certain analysis find in the lecture note of the early twentiethcentury language theorist ferdinand de saussure
in consequence of this garbling the leading assumption of deconstruction be seriously flawed if not worthless as among others john ellis have show in against deconstruction review by norman fruman in this issue of academic question
but even if one set theoretical problem aside in extreme of political bias
for logocentrism prove to be not so much a philosophical category as a way of identify and stigmatize something as bourgeois
rather than merely be deal with as a mistaken approach to reality logocentrism be take to be the crucial mean of bourgeois control over society
realityoriented language deconstructionist would have us believe function to impose a version of reality favorable to the bourgeoisie permit it to maintain its hegemony or control over the low class
derrida himself take this melodramatic politicization of the language question still far claim that the bourgeois hegemony extend over the whole globe
as he put it logocentrism be really a form of imperialism it be nothing but the most original and powerful ethnocentrism in the process of impose itself upon the world
the implication of such a statement be that when deconstruction attack logocentrism it stand forth as a champion of the oppressed third world along with anyone else the bourgeoisie can be think of as oppressing
feminist potential of the deconstructionist assault
rather than merely complain about man they could stigmatize the belief system that man have supposedly foist on the world
their term for this system be patriarchy
they accuse patriarchy of employ rigid logical category of thought that stifle woman be allegedly more intuitive instinctual kind of thought
obviously patriarchy be simply logocentrism transpose to the realm of gender
its characteristic be the same and its oppressive action be the same except that woman be substitute for the proletariat and the third world as the victim
as with logocentrism the concept of patriarchy quite fall apart under theoretical scrutiny
in the first place there be no such thing as identifiably male and female mode of thought
if there be the feminist analysis of history would force the conclusion that all culture and civilization be exclusively the creation of man with woman have be nothing more than inarticulate bystander throughout history
so supine a role for woman do the concept of patriarchy imply in woman could not possibly assert themselves in anything
there would be no theoretical way for example to account for the effectiveness of the contemporary woman s movement nor for its forceful use of language
theoretical problem aside feminist scholarship in history literary criticism and sociology devote itself to construct version of patriarchy whether it be in the action of feudal lord modem society or the plot or critical analysis of novel
in every instance woman be presume to have be casualty of action or think now categorize as patriarchal
the feminist claim to be practice a new kind of scholarship but be simply enact a version of deconstruction s attack on logocentrism
since they believe with the deconstructionist that the social system s stability rest on its dominant mode of thought whenever they identify something as patriarchal they be really perform a deconstructionlike revolutionary gesture or at the very least a gesture of protest
the new historicism
patriarchal man if he actually exist would recognize his double in the personality he would if this other new personality type actually exist
the new historicist claim to have identify a bourgeois subject sometimes refer to as the humanist subject
according to new historicist and to cultural materialist the modem personality a deplorable thing be form some time during the renaissance
at that juncture a emergent selfcentered selfish harddriving personality type push from the scene a dreamy more sensitive more humanly integrated personality
the lash of necessity to succeed in the bourgeoisdominated modem world then aborning produce the bourgeois historical subject and with him virtually all of the ill of western history since that time
not surprisingly the new historicism prove to be as theoretically unsound as deconstruction and feminism
it do not and can not produce any evidence for the existence of the bourgeois personality as richard levin have show
nor do its practitioner agree on what constitute this personality any more than they do on the characteristic of the personality type it be supposed to a version of patriarchal man who be in turn a embodiment of logocentrism
as for the new historicism it be little more than yet another way of attack western liberal society
this political purpose become clear when just as with derrida and the logocentric type a leading new historicist abandon history and theory for a direct attack on the present arrangement of thing
bourgeois discourse he write disguise a lust for communal suicide a absolute act of universal sovereignty
at this very moment therefore the bourgeois humanist subject be rush all of us toward the logical end of all its characteristic and desire a nuclear denouement
it follow that for at least one new historicist attack the bourgeoisie be not only another symbolic revolutionary act but also a urgent bid to prevent a imminent nuclear war
film theory
far more explicit about its political intention be the fourth and seemingly pure form of theoretical discourse on my list film theory
its purpose be propagandistic it seek to use movie in the service of political struggle
such a project not surprisingly require the invention of yet another equivalent of logocentrism this time locate in moviemaking technique
as bourgeois humanist man be supposedly precede by a more sensitive personality type the movie too once exist in a ideal utopian moment
simple pure movie make during the silent era before featured nonlinearity and acknowledgment of the depthillusion
according to contemporary film theory early movie do not tell their story in strict sequence and they do not attempt to deceive by pretend to be accurate representation of reality
their superior honesty presumably derive from their have be make for the early twentiethcentury proletariat whose member flock to see them in a expression of class solidarity
as rodowick explain it the preindustrial phase of cinema history be mandate by a proletarian public whose relationship to film as popular art be only later supplant by the man be yet again the villain
in the twentieth century he be still not yet satiate by his success in stamp out the prebourgeois humanist subject or by stifle female expression through the imposition of patriarchy
nor have he be render impotent by adhere to the selfdelusion of logocentrism
instead he have go ahead sinisterly to introduce in the movie both coherent narrative and a appearance of reality
as a result the glorious golden age of primitive cinema come to a end with devastating result for all but a few foreignlanguage and avantgarde film
film theory respond to this invent situation with yet another symbolic overthrow of the bourgeois order a vigorous attack on the coherence and illusion of life project by commercial movie
like the other new methodology in today s academy film theory represent itself as be at the cutting edge of contemporary philosophical development
rodowick for example describe film theory as a particular triangulation of textual semiotics psychoanalysis and althusserian marxism
as the last of down to the familiar and oldfashioned marxist fixing of blame on the bourgeoisie
whether contemporary theorist start out with logocentrism patriarchy the bourgeois humanist subject or depthillusion in filmmaking they invariably end up with a preconceived melodrama of bourgeois oppression
one need not accept the cliche of bourgeois oppression to agree that much depend on what the member of a society believe and do not believe to be true
the new theorist have demonstrate moreover that if the economic and political system of the west have become difficult to criticize from a radical perspective they be highly vulnerable to attack through their belief system
the traditional scholarly discipline in particular have be reduce to confused silence in the face of toolong assault
in contrast the new theorist have so far have to sustain few attack on their own certainty thanks to their long have shield themselves behind a virtual berlin wall of obfuscatory terminology
once it become clear though that behind that wall every edifice present the same go to emerge
deconstruction feminism the new historicism film theory and their allied methodology one can predict be destine to collapse well before the belief system or the society they have be attempt to undermine

by terry caesar
many historian have argue that santayana s the life of reason mark the inauguration of naturalism as a philosophical movement in the united state
almost none however have note that this book be acknowledge by even its sharp contemporary critic for example arthur kenyon rogers as the first comprehensive presentation of pragmatism in this country or anywhere else
in this set of book santayana characterize knowledge as nonfoundational inquiry reason as nontranscendent or immanent criticism every sort of language as expressive imaginative or poetic every part of existence as contingent or historical and philosophy itself as a reflection on problem of human finitude rather than a search for first principle or for the really real
what be more santayana never give up any of these view even when his critic stop call his philosophy pragmatic and he himself have criticize the pragmatic school and distance himself from it
so what do the pragmatic santayana and the pragmatist disagree about and do these disagreement matter in be this santayana s pragmatic naturalism be religious in way that pragmatist like john dewey joseph ratner and sidney hook could not abide while their pragmatic naturalism too often boil down to strenuous moralism to suit santayana
caricature and overstatement lurk in the wing because the pragmatist especially dewey pay a lot of attention to esthetic experience along with morality and society and even claim that esthetic experience have a religious quality
but i still think in the end that the chief bone of contention between santayana and other pragmatist lay in santayana s attention to religious or spiritual life understand as something different from moral virtue and as something more fullblooded than some sensequalifying esthetic experience
there be six overlapping way to think through this contention
first by and large the pragmatist especially after william james be preoccupied with social life
they act as social critic or sometimes cultural critic
but one of the most remarkable characteristic of their cultural criticism lie in what it neglect there of solitude
for santayana spiritual life be concerned both with life alone and with life together with the question of solitary equanimity and personal wellbeing in the face of mortality as well as with the issue of social solidarity
santayana be criticize by pragmatist for his interest in human solitude
he be charge with be a oldfashioned individualist a escapist a romantic a mystic
for his part santayana criticize the pragmatist for their inability to see that critical thought extend beyond the formulation of social policy to problem of personal wellbeing that no social policy or social relationship could solve
there be not only lots of lonesome valley that people have to walk through but also solitary discipline that bring individual profound satisfaction as well
second in the pragmatist view life be no laughing matter because it be beset by tragedy
pragmatism as hook put it be inform by a tragic sense of life by the recognition and analysis of conflict between good and good good and overriding commitment to resolve these conflict
their social criticism waxed prophetic as it call reader to this duty chide them for their failure to live up to the social promise embody in the symbol of america its democratic institution and its motto e pluribus unum
santayana see thing somewhat differently note that prophet be constitutionally incapable of a sense of humor and advise his reader that the young man who have not weep be a savage but the old man who have not laugh be a fool
human life have its compensation
in his view people should turn to the task of resolve conflict as best they could
he say that tragedy be not to be deny or explain away as be sometimes attempt in cowardly or mince philosophy
but he suggest there be no necessity demand that people be consume by it
people not too much starved or thwart by circumstance and prepare to engage in spiritual discipline could take joy just while rome burn
santayana reply that if human life be no laughing matter it be probably just deadly and not worth living
third while the pragmatist undercut the enlightenment s quest to find a way to ground knowledge in itself they endorse a enlightenment commitment to the project of human selfassertion
here be dewey
faith in the power of intelligence to imagine future which be a projection of the desirable in the present and to invent the instrumentality of its realization be our salvation
and it be a faith that must be nurture and make articulate surely a sufficiently large task for our philosophy
santayana to the contrary picture human selfassertion as both indispensable and as inevitably fall short of its aim salvation as come with the love of life in the consciousness of impotence and philosophy as provide discipline for such affection
fourth and follow the pragmatist tend to construe philosophy as socially and politically engage a kind of inquiry that prepared citizen or their as a middleclass profession offering politician technocrat and other professional synoptic blueprint on which to base their social planning
santayana especially after write the life of reason inclined toward picture philosophy as a suspension of such business a interruption of normal social action a disengagement from policy and politics a disintoxication from the particular value that happen to shape up this or that society or polity a holiday from statesmanship
philosophy he suggest let people enjoy time out for intellectual festivity celebration worship religious meditation as well as cognitive or imaginative free play
the pragmatist take this characterization of philosophy as unprofessional irresponsible and sanctimonious a residue from a old world theological distinction between this and otherworldly concern
santayana on the other hand scold pragmatist for their shortsightedness for their fixation on what he call the political and economic foreground
he ask what good political and economic system could serve if they do not afford opportunity for extrapolitical find little good to say about distinctively religious narrative practice or institution which they picture as drain energy away from the problem of man while fuel superstition and fanaticism
they follow dewey s lead by distinguish between religion and the religious
religion dewey say amount to fixed and differentiate creed and cult that be indelibly supernatural in content and socially exclusive to boot
the religious on the other hand be a esthetic quality of any activity pursue in behalf of a ideal end so inclusive that it unify the self against obstacle and in spite of threat of personal loss because of conviction of its general and enduring value
suspicious of differentiating religion from other part of culture dewey try to displace them by underscore the religious quality of esthetic experience
he say it be in the creation and enjoyment of works of art for example that
we be as it were introduce into a world beyond this world which be nevertheless the deep ordinary experience
we be carry out beyond ourselves to find ourselves
i can see no psychological ground for such property of a experience save that somehow the work of art operate to deepen and to raise to great clarity that sense of a enveloping undefined whole that accompany every normal experience
this whole be then feel as a expansion of ourselves where egotism be not make the measure of reality and value we be citizen of this vast world beyond ourselves and any intense realization of its presence with and in us bring a peculiarly satisfying sense of unity in itself and ourselves
from santayana s vantage point this talk of get beyond ourselves to find ourselves by way of a sense of a enveloping undefined whole amount to the last thin gasp of hegelian idealism truncate religious tradition to a point that be laughable
he attempt rather to make cultural space for religion and ridicule the idea of some generically religious quality that could inform any activity
he argue that the more hopeless than the attempt to have a religion that shall be no religion in particular
and he prize particular religion for provide another world to live in
""
in his view otherworldliness do indeed have a function but it be strictly cultural not transcendent or postmortem
in religious institution people practice discipline that let them suspend the order of their normal social world particularly the differentiation and hierarchy of social economic and political life
there people practice religious virtue like piety or devotion to the source of their life spirituality or devotion to their ultimate concern and charity or appreciation of what be good for others as they understand themselves
religion give people these discipline both to let them imagine thing that bond human being together no matter what their social political or economic role or circumstance happen to be and to devise practice that facilitate personal equanimity
santayana argue that these discipline the religious narrative in which they be present in exemplary way narrative be not inevitably to blame for superstition and fanaticism
rather supernaturalism or the confusion of ideal and power be accountable for these thing
but the narrative and discipline that constitute religious tradition could be reconstruct or explicate in naturalistic way without destroy either their particularity or the difference they make for people s life
finally pragmatist pictured democracy americanstyle as the divine way of do thing
they urge people to pour all the fervor and enthusiasm they may once have have for religious tradition into a devotion to political and social democracy
santayana demur unwilling to call any one form of political life divine and willing to note all the way in which modern democracy whether socialist or consumer capitalist have end up pit equity and equity homogeneity and mass life against excellence
a good government government for the people he claim turn the force of nature as far as possible from enemy into servant and the pressure of society into latent power
universal suffrage be one but by no stretch of the imagination the sole mean to that end
in principle if not in fact santayana argue timocracy be probably a better arrangement demand equal opportunity but permit unequal achievement along with government by people who merit their assigned office by the breadth and depth of their accomplishment in economic and political art
now these six conflict that i have rehearse be not news from nowhere
they have a history textually inspire most immediately by theme in emerson
these be not conflict between emerson and his critic but rather between emerson and himself
society and solitude the tragic and the comic impotence and assertion or fate and freedom prophetic reform and spiritual contemplation the grace of communion and the cant of religion american democracy as divine life live at first hand and as the land of the dead alive condemned to life at second hand all these conflict be emersonian
but they themselves be ground in s protestant forbearers whether republican or theocratic
the tension i be think about descend from reformed christian preoccupation with grace and law with the view that moral practice while indispensable do not circumscribe personal life in its most divine moment that personal equanimity in some sense require let go of moral propriety that it call for some sort of solitary new birth or recreation that reveal simultaneously the limitation and genuine advantage of the social convention we inherit on the one hand and the lovely be lovable character of mortal life on the other that do well neither cause nor secure be well that personal wellbeing can occur but that it can not be achieve because its happening be gratuitous
these view draw with great precision by traditional reformed christian thinker like jonathan edwards outlast their original supernatural and christological context
they remain central when edwards himself drop supernatural and christian language for esthetic discourse in his battle with british benevolists over the nature of true virtue
they postchristian protestant effort as william clebsch put it to respiritualize a natural outlook that have become despirited
they remain at the heart of william james s quest to satisfy what he call the religious demand by search for supernatural power at work in the world
more to the point they shape santayana s utterly naturalistic understanding of the stress and strain between moral and spiritual practice
for that matter they also haunt dewey s equally naturalistic vision of the way in which esthetic experience outstrip as he put it moral consecration of the status quo
""
but now i want to ask who care about these tension anymore or to put it more personally and assertively why do i care about the prospect for a religious naturalism like santayana s and be my concern simply selfindulgent and atavistic i care because i share these view with santayana if we be concerned with the problem and promise of human finitude we have best attend to society and solitude because thing that impede it without come to grip with both
if by the promise of human finitude we mean the realization of such joy we have better make room for comedy as well as tragedy in our sense of life because it be comedy not tragedy that take joy as seriously as it do meanness
the comic sense require us to accept finitude and ultimate impotence along with our commitment to disclose the pretension of selfassertion
along with a devotion to human solidarity and often in its service philosopher in the west have traditionally break away from recommend social policy to meditate on such condition and our culture would be better off if they continue to do this
stripped of false explanatory account that turn ideal into power account that let people pretend that the universe work for truth and right forever or that empower us whoever we be so that we can dominate them whoever they be traditional religious institution narrative and cultural function
democracy americanstyle be not the divine way of do thing and the spiritual exceptionalism that suggest that it be by collapsing eschatology and nationalism into one another have foster more than a modicum of cruelty
american democracy be a handy way in my view if not santayana s probably the handiest to structure life politically
but this be so in great part because democracy have secure a culture that be eclectic thrive on a diversity of moral and religious tradition a culture endanger by homogeneity whether unbearably light or weighty
indeed democracy s worth as a political system be to be measure not simply by its commitment to selfdetermination or by its economic facility but also and more by its ability to sustain this diversity of tradition that discipline imagination in way that give point to human life
to my mind these six area of inquiry constitute a program of study for religious naturalist to pursue
so let me tip my own hand all too briefly me be commit to human solidarity
but we know that there be line some fine some coarse separating concord cooperation and fellowship from the sort of mass or bulk or uniformed life where as milan kundera have put it unity of mankind mean no escape for anyone anywhere
we accept harmony as a superordinate goal to keep in mind when shape up social attitude but we reject oneness unanimity and the deterioration of private life
why be this so why do the story of say kafka and kundera that explore the violation of solitude strike home to us with such force be it because we be socially dysfunctional or politically naive misanthrope incurable romantic or mystic dilettante no
it be because we think that human wellbeing or joy depend as much on what go on in people when they be by themselves as on what happen in their interaction with other people as much on private transformation and association as on social justice because more than anything else what be at stake be the imaginative life
it be important however not to read old epistemological or metaphysical presumption into this phrase
as i turn it at least there be nothing epistemologically private or asocial about imaginative life nothing metaphysical about it
i be for example write this piece not only for myself but for anyone willing to see or hear it and my capacity to do so be the outcome of a lot of socialization and training
my effort like all effort be experience and observable as plainly physical
but i have also turn aside from normal social activity ask people not to disturb me so that i might work out this way of thinking work on myself play with variation on old theme concerning human joy and the thing impede it
in so do i be as james would say experience the practice of imagination as solitary
cultural arrangement and discipline make this possible discipline propose new one and my performance play a cultural role
moreover i be given leave to do so by way of political and economic legitimation
but it be the performance my solitary attention to a interest my practical competence not social relationship or policy per se that be at risk and be the site of whatever agony and joy or sense of beauty go on
the performance may or may not be good for anything else in particular
